channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Deadline looms as Anthropic rejects Pentagon demands it remove AI safeguards
item.description: The Defense Department has been feuding with Anthropic over military uses of its artificial intelligence tools. At stake are hundreds of millions of dollars in contracts and access to some of the most advanced AI on the planet.
item.content:encoded:
The Defense Department has been feuding with Anthropic over military uses of its artificial intelligence tools. At stake are hundreds of millions of dollars in contracts and access to some of the most advanced AI on the planet.

(Image credit: Patrick Sison)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Hillary Clinton calls House Oversight questioning 'repetitive' in 6 hour deposition
item.description: In more than seven hours behind closed doors, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton answered questions from the House Oversight Committee as it investigates Jeffrey Epstein.
item.content:encoded:
In more than seven hours behind closed doors, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton answered questions from the House Oversight Committee as it investigates Jeffrey Epstein.

(Image credit: Yuki Iwamura)
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: Chicagoans pay respects to Jesse Jackson as cross-country memorial services begin
item.description: Memorial services for the Rev. Jesse Jackson Sr. to honor his long civil rights legacy begin in Chicago. Events will also take place in Washington, D.C., and South Carolina, where he was born and began his activism.
item.content:encoded:
Memorial services for the Rev. Jesse Jackson Sr. to honor his long civil rights legacy begin in Chicago. Events will also take place in Washington, D.C., and South Carolina, where he was born and began his activism.

(Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How the Epstein file saga is fueling extremist conspiracies
item.description: Researchers of online extremism say lack of public accountability in relation to the release of the latest Epstein files has bred a worrying mixture of cynicism and nihilism in some online spaces.
item.content:encoded: Researchers of online extremism say lack of public accountability in relation to the release of the latest Epstein files has bred a worrying mixture of cynicism and nihilism in some online spaces.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Jesse Jackson lies in repose
item.description: The official memorials for Jesse Jackson began this week. The late civil rights leader is lying in repose at his Rainbow-Push Coalition headquarters in Chicago Thursday and Friday.
item.content:encoded: The official memorials for Jesse Jackson began this week. The late civil rights leader is lying in repose at his Rainbow-Push Coalition headquarters in Chicago Thursday and Friday.
item.dc:creator: Cheryl Corley

item.title: Columbia student detained by ICE is abruptly released after Mamdani meets with Trump
item.description: Hours after the student was taken into custody in her campus apartment, she was released, after New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani expressed concerns about the arrest to President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Hours after the student was taken into custody in her campus apartment, she was released, after New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani expressed concerns about the arrest to President Trump.

(Image credit: Seth Wenig)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: These major issues have brought together Democrats and Republicans in states
item.description: Across the country, Republicans and Democrats have found bipartisan agreement on regulating artificial intelligence and data centers. But it's not just big tech aligning the two parties.
item.content:encoded:
Across the country, Republicans and Democrats have found bipartisan agreement on regulating artificial intelligence and data centers. But it's not just big tech aligning the two parties.

(Image credit: Ted Shaffrey)
item.dc:creator: Regan McCarthy

item.title: Secretly rewritten nuclear safety rules are made public
item.description: The Energy Department made the rules public a month after NPR reported about their existence. The rules slash requirements for security and environmental protections.
item.content:encoded:
The Energy Department made the rules public a month after NPR reported about their existence. The rules slash requirements for security and environmental protections.

(Image credit: Idaho National Laboratory)
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Is the U.S. headed toward a military conflict with Iran?
item.description: New York Times journalist David Sanger discusses how we got here, the state of Iran's nuclear weapons program, the likelihood of U.S. military force against Iran and if Trump's goal is regime change.
item.content:encoded: New York Times journalist David Sanger discusses how we got here, the state of Iran's nuclear weapons program, the likelihood of U.S. military force against Iran and if Trump's goal is regime change.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: Pentagon shifts toward maintaining ties to Scouting
item.description: Months after NPR reported on the Pentagon's efforts to sever ties with Scouting America, efforts to maintain the partnership have new momentum
item.content:encoded:
Months after NPR reported on the Pentagon's efforts to sever ties with Scouting America, efforts to maintain the partnership have new momentum

(Image credit: David Ryder)
item.dc:creator: Graham Smith
